Name: Wholemeal toast with hummus and alvocado
Recipe: Toast the bread. Spread with a layer of hummus. Cover with a few slices of avocado. Ready to consume.

Name: Wholemeal toast with olive oil and fresh cheese
Recipe: Toast the bread and, when toasted, add a drizzle of olive oil. Cut two slices of cheese on one side. Serve the toast with the cheese on one side and the fruit on the other.

Name: Porridge with seasonal fruits
Recipe: Heat the milk or vegetable milk in a small saucepan over a low heat. When it is hot, add the hazelnut flakes and mix until you have a more or less homogeneous mixture. Wash, peel (optional) and chop the fruit. Half is enough. Serve the hot porridge in a bowl with the fruit pieces on top.

Name: Baked apple
Ingredients of a standard portion for an:
Apple,200,g;
Cinnamon,5,g;
Recipe: Preheat the oven to 180 degrees for ten minutes. Cut off the top of the apple, remove the core, cut open the top, sprinkle with a little cinnamon and cover again. Put the apple in the oven on a baking tray at 180 degrees for about 60 minutes. When cooked, remove and serve, or leave to cool and eat cold or as applesause.

Name: Fruit and seed salad
Recipe: Wash, peel (optional), chop and mix the fruit. Add the sesame seeds and mix. Serve in a bowl.

Name: Turkey, apple and rocket sandwich
Recipe: Slice the bread crosswise, add a drizzle of olive oil, the turkey and the washed rocket to one half of the bread. Wash the apple and cut into thin slices. Add the apple to the sandwich and serve.

Name: Whole grain cereal bowl with milk (or vegetable drink)

Milk (or vegetable drink),200,ml;
Whole grain cereals,60,g;

Peanut butter,10,g;

Name: Whole wheat fajita with avocado and fresh cheese
Whole-bread pancakes with strawberries and chocolate
Recipe: In a blender glass, mix the egg, milk and flour. Beat until you get a light texture. In a non-stick frying pan we put a ladle of the prepared dough and cook the pancakes. Serve with natural cut strawberries and dark chocolate.

Name: Kefir with apple and walnuts
Wholemeal toast with olive oil, tomato and natural tuna
Recipe: Cut the bread in half and toast. Serve on a plate with olive oil and tuna and sliced tomato on top.

Name: French omelette
Recipe: Crack the eggs and mix them with a whisk. Add the salt and mix until getting a homogeneous mixture.Heat a non-stick pan and add the egg mixture, lowering the heat to medium intensity and shaking the pan constantly. Once curdled, roll the omelette on itself.

Name: Potatoes omelette
Recipe: Wash and peel the potatoes and onion, cut it into slices, and steam or microwave. Mix the potatoes and onion with eggs and salt. Heat a non-stick pan and paint the bottom with a few drops of olive oil. Add the mixture into the pan lowering the heat to medium/low. After 3-4 min.turn the omelette with the help of a plate and put it back in the pan. Let cook 2 more min. Finally, remove from heat and serve.
Tip: Lightly season, then serve with crusty bread to mop up all of the juices.

Name: Scrambled eggs with prawns and wild asparagus
Recipe: Boil the asparagus for 2 min. and drain. Beat the eggs with the salt. Heat a non-stick pan and add the oil. Brown the garlic and sauté the prawns for 2-3 min. over medium heat. Add the beaten eggs and lower the heat. Mix continuously until the egg is curdled.

Name: Soft boiled egg
Recipe: Bring the water to the boil in a saucepan. Dip the eggs, which should not be too cold or they will crack, into the boiling water. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes, depending on the degree of doneness. Meanwhile, toast the bread. Drain and place in an egg cup before serving, peel and open the top. Cut the bread in strips and add olive oil. Ready to serve. Bread can be sucked into the egg.

Name: Onion and garlic omelette
Recipe: In a frying pan, heat the olive oil and when it is hot, fry the onion. When it changes colour, add the garlic. Beat the eggs and add to the frying pan. Form an omelette with a spatula and serve when ready.

Name: Baked tuna and egg empanada
Recipe: Mix the dough ingredients (flour, yeast, salt, oil and water). Knead for 10 minutes. Leave the dough to rise in a bowl covered with a cloth for 1 hour, until it has doubled in size. After this time, knead again and divide into two parts. Shape the dough into a patty and put aside. In a frying pan, fry the onion and corn in a little extra virgin olive oil. When poached, add the tuna, drained of oil and water, the chopped olives and the homemade sofrito*. Cook well, then remove from the heat and add the oregano and finely chopped eggs. When the filling has cooled, place it on one of the pies. Sprinkle with a little cheese and cover with the pastry, pressing the edges together to prevent it from falling apart. Bake in the oven at 180ºC until golden brown. Ready to serve. *Chop the tomatoes and onion and place in a covered pan with a little extra virgin olive oil over a medium heat. Cook until the liquid has reduced).

Name: Scrambled eggs with vegetables
Recipe: Peel and cut the onion into small cubes and cook in a preheated pan with oil. Wash the asparagus and broccoli and cut the edible parts into small pieces. Wash and peel the tomatoes, cut them into cubes. When the onion is cooked, add the asparagus and broccoli. Sauté everything over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add the chopped tomato, concentrated tomato and water. Season with cumin, ground black pepper and salt. Stir integrating all the ingredients. Let cook for 5 more minutes. Add the peas. Stir and make two eggs in the pan where you place the eggs. Lower the intensity of the fire, cover the pan and let cook for 3 minutes. Serve.

Name: egg, courgette and onion tart
Recipe: Wash and chop the onion and courgette. Brown them in a frying pan with a little olive oil. Remove and set aside. Beat the eggs and add a pinch of salt. Mix the eggs with the courgette and onion in a glass dish. Add the milk or vegetable milk. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees for 10 minutes. Bake for about 20 minutes. Take out of the oven and serve.

Name: Fried eggs with sauteed vegetables
Recipe: Wash and slice the vegetables. Put them in a pan with olive oil and fry them. Fry the eggs on the other side. When both are cooked, serve on a plate.

Name: Scrambled eggs with ham
Recipe: Peel and slice the potatoes and rinse well under running water, drain well. Pour the oil into a large frying pan or casserole, add the potatoes and cook over a medium heat, keeping them covered; when you see that they are tender, increase the heat to maximum and cook until they are brown. Take out the potatoes and leave them on a paper towel. Place the potatoes on the plate or dish in which they will be served. Place the ham on top of the potatoes. Fry the eggs and put them in the enzyme. Now you are ready to eat.

Name: Risotto with pear, spinach and walnuts
Recipe: Wash and drain the spinach. Brown the finely chopped garlic and onion in a pan with a little oil. Add the spinach, cover and let cook. Add the rice and let it toast. Add the peeled and diced pear. Add the broth and mix until completely absorbed and until the rice is cooked to the correct point. Serve the risotto with chopped walnuts, raw extra virgin olive oil and Parmesan cheese.

Name: Cuba style rice
Recipe: Boil the rice in plenty of water and drain. Grill the egg with a little oil. Serve and add tomato sauce.

Name: Shrimp rice noodles
Recipe: Boil the noodles according to the manufacturer's instructions and then drain. Clean and chop the peppers and broccoli into thin strips. Clean the prawns. Heat a frying pan and sauté the prawns with the vegetables and olive oil. Mix the noodles with the vegetables and shrimp.

Name: Chicken rice salad
Recipe: Soak the rice for a few minutes. Cook according to the manufacturer's instructions (about 12 minutes). Drain in a sieve. To make the dressing, mix the oil and vinegar in a bowl and add a pinch of ground cumin. Mix well to emulsify and set aside. Chop the green asparagus and drain the cooked corn. Cut the tomatoes into small pieces and prepare the roast chicken by cutting the breast into small pieces. Mix the ingredients so that they are well distributed and season to taste. Ready to serve.

Name: Stuffed tomatoes with brown rice and tuna
Recipe: Cut the extreme part of the tomatoes around the stem. Empty them with a spoon and leave them upside down so that all the water and seeds drain out. Wash, peel and grate the carrot. In a large bowl, mix the well-drained tuna, the rice, the white spreadable cheese, the grated carrot and season to taste. Fill the tomatoes, decorate them with half an olive. Take to the fridge before serving. Serve.

Name: Soupy rice with vegetables
Recipe: Peel and chop all the vegetables: peppers, asparagus, carrots, garlic and grate the tomatoes. Brown the garlic in a little extra virgin olive oil. Add the peppers, carrots and asparagus. Stir and fry. Add the grated tomato and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the rice and stir. Add the stock and when it starts to boil, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 12-15 minutes. After 15 minutes, leave the rice to stand for 5 minutes. Ready to serve. Optional: You can add a squeeze of lemon juice to 'dress' the rice before serving.

Name: Mushroom risotto
Recipe:
Wipe the mushrooms with damp paper. Chop the onion, garlic and mushrooms.  Brown the onion in olive oil in a frying pan. Add the mushrooms and garlic. Add the rice and cook for a few minutes. Pour in the white wine and allow the alcohol to evaporate. Mix well, add a ladle of vegetable stock and start stirring the rice in a continuous motion (in a circle). When you see that the stock is almost gone, add another ladle and stir the rice again. This process will be repeated several times, adding more stock but always making sure that there is never a shortage of liquid. When the rice is cooked to perfection, remove the pan from the heat and add the grated Grana Padano cheese.
Stir with circular movements so that the cheese melts and the rice becomes creamy.  Serve hot at the table.

Name: Three-delight rice
Recipe: Cut the carrot into small cubes and cook in a saucepan with water and a little salt. Open the tin of peas. Beat the eggs with the salt and make a French omelette in two batches in a very hot frying pan with half a spoonful of olive oil. The omelette should be very thin, like a crêpe. Meanwhile, put the rice in another pan with water to cook. It will be ready in about ten minutes, depending on the type of rice, then drain and set aside. Now prepare the three delicious rice dishes. Place the well-drained rice in the frying pan and season with the appropriate tablespoon of soy sauce. Once well browned, add the rest of the ingredients, frying until they all mix in the pan, and when ready, serve immediately.

Name: Curry rice
Recipe: Wash the rice in a sieve to remove the starch. Wash and chop the carrot and set aside. Peel and chop the onion and garlic. In a large frying pan, fry the onion in two tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil and when it is soft, add the carrot. Cook for a few minutes, then add the garlic, ginger and spices. Meanwhile, heat the vegetable stock in a saucepan and keep it warm. Add the rice to the pan and fry it with the spices for a few minutes until it turns pearly. Add the stock to the pan, stirring gently, and cook for about 10 minutes or until the stock is used up. Serve and eat.

Name: Rice salad with fresh salmon or tuna and peas
Recipe: Wash, peel and chop the carrot and pepper. Cook the rice in water until al dente (12-15 minutes). Cook the peas (frozen or fresh) and leave to cool. Prepare the vinaigrette*. Mix all the ingredients together with the canned salmon or tuna or, if fresh, grill it first. Ready to serve. *Vinaigrette: Grate and squeeze the lemon, add the olive oil, vinegar, a pinch of salt and pepper and mix well.

Name: Cous-cous salad
Recipe: Bring the water to the boil with a little oil and a pinch of salt. When it comes to the boil, add the appropriate number of cups of couscous. Stir with a spoon and leave for at least three or four minutes. Cover. Peel and chop the tomato and cucumber. In a bowl, add the chopped vegetables to the couscous. Add some fresh mint. Sprinkle with lemon juice and a little olive oil. You can also add some chopped olives. Serve with lime slices.

Name: Macaroni with bolognese sauce
Recipe: Peel and finely chop the onion and carrot. Preheat a pan with oil. Add the vegetables and cook over medium-low heat for 10 minutes. Stir to prevent it from sticking. Add lean minced meat. Season with salt, oregano and pepper and integrate all the ingredients. Cook the meat for 10 minutes. Add the vegetable broth and raise the heat for 2 or 3 minutes. Add the crushed tomato along with the milk and lower the heat. Let cook for 20 minutes on low heat. Add plenty of water to a pot and place over high heat until it boils. Add the macaroni and salt when the water is boiling. Lower the heat and cook for 7-8 minutes. After this time, drain the macaroni and add them to the sauce pan. Mix the ingredients with the fire already turned off. Serve.

Name: Green spaghetti
Recipe: Wash the spinach. Add them to a preheated pan with a little water to prevent them from sticking. Season with salt and cook for 3 minutes. Reserve. Peel and finely chop the onion and garlic. In a skillet add oil and cook the onion and garlic for 10 minutes or until golden. Meanwhile, place plenty of water in a pot and place it over high heat until it boils. Add salt and spaghetti. Cook for 8 minutes. Using a hand blender, blend the spinach, basil, fresh cheese, milk, nuts and a little water. Blend until a thick sauce is left. Add the sauce to the pan with the garlic and onion, season with salt and cook over low heat for 5 minutes. When the noodles are ready, reserve part of the cooking water in a separate container, and drain the rest. Add the noodles to the pan with the sauce. If the sauce is not fluid add cooking water. Serve.

Name: Spaghetti with mushrooms and spinach sauce
Recipe: Cook the pasta. Drain and keep the water. Mix the ricotta with less than ¼ of the cooking water (add more water if necessary). Clean and chop the carrots, mushrooms, garlic and spinach and chop the almonds. Heat a non-stick frying pan with a few drops of extra virgin olive oil and sauté the garlic, carrot, almonds and mushrooms over a medium heat. Add the ricotta together with the cooking water and let it boil down. When ready, add the drained pasta to the sautéed vegetables. Season and stir. Ready to serve.

Name: Macaroni with peas, ham and mushrooms
Recipe: Peel and chop the garlic. Brown the mushrooms and garlic in a non-stick frying pan. When browned, add the peas and cook a little. When the peas are cooked, add the chopped ham. Cook for a few more minutes, cover and leave to cook for 5 minutes. Cook the spaghetti according to the instructions on the packet. Drain and mix. Ready to serve.

Name: Pasta with carrot cream and ricotta cheese
Recipe: Cook the pasta according to the instructions on the packet. When cooked to your liking, drain and rinse under cold water to stop cooking. Set aside. Slice the carrots and roast in the oven at 220ºC for 20-30 minutes with a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil. Blend the carrots with the vegetable drink or milk and the cottage cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Blend well until smooth and free of lumps. Serve hot on the pasta and garnish with the Provencal herbs. Serve immediately.

Name: Spaghetti with broccoli and cheese cream
Recipe: Put a pan of hot water on the stove. When it boils, add the spaghetti and cook according to the instructions on the packet. Drain and rinse under cold water. Keep the cooking water. Wash and grate the broccoli. Set aside. Peel and chop the onion and garlic. Put them in a frying pan with a drop of extra virgin olive oil. Cook until golden brown. Add the cheese mixture. Cook over a medium heat. Stir constantly. When thickened, add salt and pepper to taste. Add the spaghetti and mix well to soak up the cream cheese. Add the broccoli and a ladle of the water from cooking the spaghetti. Mix well again and cook until all the water has evaporated, all the ingredients are well incorporated and the spaghetti is creamy. Ready to serve.

Name: Spaghetti with pear and goat's cheese
Recipe: Cook the pasta according to instructions. When cooked, rinse with cold water to stop cooking and leave to cool. Chop the walnuts, peel and chop the pear and cheese. Mix everything together and add the olive oil and oregano. Ready to eat.

Name: Baked macaroni and cheese au gratin
Recipe: Cook the macaroni according to instructions. Clean and chop the vegetables separately. In a frying pan, fry the onion with the garlic and add the courgette. Add the chopped tomato and cook over a low heat. When cooked, mix the macaroni with the sauce and pour the mixture into a deep dish. Add the grated cheese and grill for 10-15 minutes at 180 degrees. Remove and serve.

Name: Vegetable soup with noodles
Recipe: Wash and chop the carrot. Cook it in the broth. Add the cooked pasta and peas. Serve and eat.

Name: Cod brandade
Recipe: Pour the oil and the peeled and filleted garlic cloves into a frying pan. Heat without burning the garlic. Add the cod to the pan and cook on a low heat for two or three minutes, then cover and leave to cook until all the gelatine has dissolved. Strain the cod and garlic, keeping the oil. Place the cod (desalted and boned) in a bowl with the milk and stir with a whisk to break up the cod. Add the reserved oil and whisk to emulsify until you have a smooth cream. Ready to serve.

Name: Rabbit stewed with garlic
Recipe: The first thing to do is season the rabbit with salt and pepper so that it gets the flavour. Peel and crush the garlic. Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over a medium heat. Add the garlic and chilli pepper and fry them a little at a time, taking care not to burn them; when the garlic is golden brown, remove it and put it and the chilli pepper to one side. Turn up the heat a little and add the rabbit to the casserole, browning it by turning the pieces. The rabbit should be well browned, but it is important to do this over a medium heat so that the meat does not dry out and shrink too much. When it is evenly browned, add the garlic and chilli. Add a few sprigs of thyme, a glass of white wine and a few spoonfuls of cider vinegar. Allow the alcohol to evaporate a little, reduce the heat to low and cover. Leave to cook for 20 to 30 minutes. When cooked, remove from the heat and serve.

Name: Galician style octopus
Recipe: Clean the octopus with cold water. In a large pot with plenty of water and place over high heat until it boils. Add the octopus. Put the octopus in and out of the pot 3 times, to prevent the skin from coming out during cooking. Cook for 30-40 minutes over medium heat, until tender. Wash, peel and cut the potatoes into slices. Reserve. Take the octopus out of the water once it is cooked, and use that pot with the water to boil the potatoes, so that they acquire flavor. Cook for 15 minutes. Chop the octopus. Serve the potatoes in a bowl as a base for the octopus. Season with salt, sweet paprika and olive oil. Serve.

Name: Escalivada
Recipe: Preheat the oven to 160ºC. Wash and cut the aubergine, onion, zucchini and pepper into strips. Place in a bowl, the vegetables with oil and season to taste. Mix well. Grease a baking sheet with oil and place the vegetables. Cook in the oven over medium heat for 30 minutes. Check the vegetables frequently, preventing them from browning. Peel and chop the garlics. Once the vegetables are cooked, remove from the oven, recover the cooking juice. Serve on a tray and add the minced garlic, olive oil and ground black pepper on top.

Name: Andalusian gazpacho
Recipe: Wash the tomatoes, cucumber and pepper well. Quarter the tomatoes and chop the cucumber, pepper and garlic and add it all in a bowl. Soak the stale bread in another bowl with water for about 10 minutes. Add the bread to the bowl of vegetables and add extra virgin olive oil and salt. Blend with a blender until smooth. Strain with a strainer and chill in the fridge.

Name: Russian salad
Recipe: Wash and peel the potato and carrot and then cut them into squares. Boil for about 35 minutes over medium heat. Boil an egg with water and salt for 10 minutes. Peel and cut the hard-boiled egg into small pieces and leave to cool. Cut the olives and put everything in a bowl. Wash the peas and drain them. Add them in the bowl. Drain the natural tuna and add it too. Mix all the ingredients and add the homemade mayonnaise. Let cool in the fridge.

Name: Baked chicken croquettes
Recipe:
The day before: chop the onion and fry it in a frying pan with very little extra virgin olive oil. Add the shredded and boneless chicken. Add the cornmeal and lightly toast it. Cover with milk and add the nutmeg and salt to taste .Mix well to avoid lumps until it thickens.When it has thickened, reserve in a glass container and let it warm.Cover with film and let it rest in the fridge overnight.
The same day: Preheat the oven to 160ºC. Shape the croquettes with the help of a few spoons: pass through the egg and breadcrumbs. Place on a baking tray with previously placed baking paper. Drizzle with little olive oil. Bake for 15 minutes.

Name: Seafood paella
Recipe: Wash, dice the onion, pepper and tomato. In a skillet over high heat add the olive oil and mark the chicken breasts. Then add the vegetables and prepare the sauce. When the vegetables and chicken are cooked add the rice, the prawns and the saffron and cover with the seafood broth. Cook over medium heat for 20 minutes.

Name: Beef stew with potatoes
Recipe: Wash, cut the carrot. In a pot with hot oil, mark the veal, reserve. Next, in the same pot add the carrot and the peas and sauté it together with the veal. Finally add the peeled and chopped potato and the meat broth. Let cook for 1 hour on medium heat

Name: Beef cannelloni
Recipe: For the cannelloni filling: First, cook the onion and green pepper over low heat. Once poached, add the minced meat, season with salt and pepper and add the tomato sauce. Next we cook the pasta for the cannelloni. Once cooked, fill with the meat, add the béchamel, the cheese and bake it at 180ºC for 15 minutes.

Name: Chickpea salad with tomatoes and tuna belly
Recipe: Drain and wash the canned chickpeas. Drain the water from the can of tuna belly and reserve. Wash and cut the cherry tomatoes in half and the onion. Mix the chickpeas with the vegetables, the tuna belly and the black olives, season with salt and pepper and stir well. Reserve and dress.

Name: Red lentil salad
Recipe:
Wash, peel and cut the onion and put in a bowl. Wash and drain the lentils, arrange in a salad bowl. Cut the bell pepper and carrot into thin strips and cubes. Boil the quinoa in water. Rinse the onion under cold water and pat dry with kitchen paper. Pour everything into the salad bowl and mix.
Season with extra virgin olive oil.

Name: Chickpea and cod salad (Empedrat)
Recipe: Soak the cod to remove as much salt as possible. Clean and drain the chickpeas, reserve. Clean and cut the tomato and pepper into small cubes and the onion into slices. Boil the eggs until they are to the point that we like. Drain the cod. Mix all the ingredients well (chickpeas, cod, olives and vegetables). Season with a little extra virgin olive oil and salt. Chop the hard-boiled egg and add it to the plate.

Name: Shredded cod salad (Esqueixada)
Recipe: Wash the peppers, spring onion and tomatoes. Cut into small pieces and mix with the crumbled cod. Add the black olives. Season with olive oil to taste.

Name: Green salad with zucchini and sesame
Recipe: Wash and cut all lettuce and green leaves. With the help of a spirali, make the zucchini spaghetti. Prepare the dressing with the olive oil with a pinch of salt. Mix all the ingredients and sprinkle the toasted sesame.

Name: Green salad with goat cheese
Recipe: Wash and drain well the chard leaves or lettuce sprouts or mixture of green leaves. Brown the walnuts in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. When they toast a little, reserve. Brown the goat cheese on both sides (crispy outside and creamy inside). Distribute the lettuce leaves, nuts, raisins and clean strawberries. Season with extra virgin olive oil.

Name: Green sprout, apple and pomegranate salad
Recipe: Wash, dry and chop the escarole. Wash and cut the apple in half, remove the seeds and cut into thin slices. Cut the pomegranate in half and beat until all the grains come out. Add the raisins. Mix all the ingredients in a bowl and dress with extra virgin olive oil.

Name: Cold pasta salad with mushrooms, cherry tomatoes and fresh mozzarella
Recipe: Cook the pasta in plenty of boiling water. Wash and slice the mushrooms and fry them in a pan with a little olive oil until golden brown. Cut the cherry tomatoes, the black olives and the fresh mozzarella. Add the cooked and drained pasta in a bowl, together with the mushrooms, the cherry tomatoes, the black olives, the basil and the fresh mozzarella. Season with olive oil and salt. Serve.

Name: Brown rice salad with vegetables and mozzarella
Recipe: Put the rice and peas to boil with water and a little salt over medium heat for about 20-30 minutes. Cut the vegetables and nuts into small pieces (pepper, spring onion, cherrys). Mix the rice, peas and vegetables in a bowl and add the fresh mozzarella and walnuts. Season with extra virgin olive oil and salt to taste.

Name: Vegetable salad
Recipe: Wash and cut all the vegetables. Plate and dress with extra virgin olive oil and vinegar.

Name: Caesar salad
Recipe: Wash and cut the lettuce. Grill the chicken. Mix all the ingredients in a bowl and add the Parmesan cheese, the caesar sauce and the croutons.

Name: Greek salad with watermelon
Recipe: Wash and cut the vegetables. Add the feta cheese and watermelon and dress with olive oil and vinegar.

Name: Corn salad with avocado and natural nachos
Recipe: Wash and cut the tomato and onion into cubes, open the avocado and chop it very fine. Season with lemon so that it does not oxidize and mix with the corn, tomatoes and onion. Eat with nachos.

Name: Country salad
Recipe: Wash and cut the vegetables. Cook the potatoes in boiling water. Let cool and chop them to taste. Add tuna and egg and dress with extra virgin olive oil and viagre.

Name: Mushrooms sautéed with garlic
Recipe: Wash, cut the mushrooms and garlic into slices. In a frying pan, heat olive oil and sauté the garlic, add the mushrooms, cover and cook for 15 minutes over medium heat. Add fresh parsley.

Name: Sautéed zucchini and carrot spaghetti with sesame
Recipe: Clean and peel the zucchini and carrot. Cut the vegetables into thin strips, simulating strips of spaghetti. Heat a frying pan, add the oil and the garlic cut into fine slices. Sauté the vegetables on a plate with sesame seeds.

Name: Boiled cauliflower with bechamel sauce and grated mozzarella cheese
Recipe: Cook the cauliflower. To prepare the bechamel sauce, heat a pot with a drizzle of olive oil, add the wholemeal flour and cook over low heat, gradually adding the milk and finally the nutmeg and heat until a thick sauce is obtained. In a baking dish, add the cauliflower, the bechamel sauce and the mozzarella cheese. Bake for 15 minutes at 175º

Name: Whole wheat toast with ratatouille and grilled egg
Recipe: Wash, peel and dice the pepper, zucchini and onion. Then sauté all the vegetables with a drizzle of olive oil. When the vegetables are cooked add 2 tablespoons of tomato sauce. Prepare the grilled egg. Toast a slice of wholemeal bread serve with ratatouille and the grilled egg

Name: Eggplant, zucchini and potato veggie moussaka
Recipe: Wash, peel and slice the eggplants, zucchini and potatoes. Prepare the vegetable slices and cover with a layer of tomato sauce and bechamel sauce in a baking dish. Finally, we add the emmental cheese, cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 1 hour at 190 ºC.

Name: Tomato, cucumber and Chickpea salad
Recipe: Wash, peel and cut the tomato, cucumber and onion, reserve in a salad bowl. Boil the chickpeas, rinse and let cool. Mix the vegetables with the chickpeas, add salt, oil and vinegar.

Name: Cold tomato soup with boiled egg and serrano ham
Recipe: Wash and cut and crush the tomatoes. In a bowl place the bread and cover with the crushed tomato let stand ten minutes. Add the garlic, salt and olive oil. Blend the entire mixture until a light texture is obtained. Serve with boiled egg and Serrano ham cubes.

Name: Green beans with potatoes
Recipe: Wash, peel and cut the beans and potatoes. In a pot with water and salt, cook the potatoes and beans. In a frying pan add the oil and garlic and sauté, then add the beans and sauté over medium heat for 7 minutes.

Name: Pumpkin and zucchini cream with croutons
Recipe: Wash, peel and cut the pumpkin, zucchini and leek. In a pot, sauté the vegetables in oil and add the salt and pepper. Then add the vegetable broth and cook over medium heat for half an hour. Finally shredding the vegetables.

Name: Leek and potato vichyssoise
Recipe: Peel, wash the leek and the partata. Cut the potatoes into cubes. Cut the white part of the leeks into two or three halves. Add the oil in a pot and sauté the potato and leek for 10 minutes, season with a pinch of salt, pepper and lemon juice, cover with the chicken broth and cook over medium heat for 30 minutes. Blend the vegetables adding the whole milk until obtaining a fine texture, reserve in the fridge. Serve with chopped chives.

Name: Cold garlic and almonds soup with grapes and ham
Recipe: We start by soaking the bread crumb in cold water. Next, we put the soaked bread, the raw almonds, the garlic clove, the vinegar, the salt in a blender glass and we crush everything. Serve with peeled grapes and pieces of serrano ham.

Name: Sautéed artichokes with garlic and grilled egg
Recipe: Peel and cut the artichokes. In a pot cook the artichokes when they are cooked strain and reserve. In a frying pan, heat the oil and add the minced garlic clove, sauté together with the artichokes. Serve with a grilled egg.

Name: Broccoli and peas soup with seeds
Recipe: Cut and wash the broccoli and the leek, in a pot we sauté the vegetables and add the peas. Next, add the chicken broth and cook for 30 minutes over medium heat. Finally, blend until a fine texture is obtained. Serve with seeds.

Name: Quinoa and tuna stuffed tomatoes
Recipe: Wash and empty the tomatoes with the help of a spoon, cut the tomato pulp into cubes and reserve the wrapper. Then wash and cut the pepper and onion into small cubes. In a frying pan, add the olive oil and sauté the vegetables together with the tomato pulp, cook for 10 minutes over medium heat. In a pot, cook the quinoa and add it together with the vegetables and a can of tuna. Finally, fill the tomatoes with the mixture of quinoa, vegetables and tuna. Serve with chopped fresh parsley.

Name: Catalan-style peas with cured ham
Recipe: In a casserole or frying pan, brown the ham, add the chopped spring onion and chopped garlic and cook over a low heat for 2-3 minutes, stirring to prevent burning. Leave the casserole with the muscatel (or whatever alcohol you want to use) and let the alcohol evaporate. Add the peeled peas, salt lightly, add the stock, cover and cook over a medium heat for 2 to 4 minutes. The cooking time of the peas varies according to their size. When there is 1 minute left, add the chopped mint and finish cooking the Catalan peas with Iberian ham. Ready to serve.

Name: Lentil soup
Recipe: Rinse the lentils in cold water and set aside. Heat some oil in a large pot and sauté the onion, garlic, carrot, and celery until they soften. Add the lentils, vegetable broth, and spices to the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil and reduce the heat to low. Simmer the soup for about 30 minutes, or until the lentils are tender. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Name: Chickpeas with spinach
Recipe: Rinse chickpeas and reserve spinach and tomato puree. Thinly slice garlic and finely dice onion. Heat olive oil in a non-stick frying pan and cook garlic and onion until golden. Add cumin, smoked paprika, tomato puree, salt, pepper, and sugar. Add spinach, cover, and cook for 2 minutes. Add chickpeas, season again with salt and pepper, cook for 4 more minutes, and transfer to a bowl.

Name: Catalonian broad beans
Recipe: Boil the broad beans in boiling water with a little salt for approximately 20 minutes, then drain and set aside. Next, peel and chop the onion and sauté it in a pan with olive oil over low heat, adding salt, and then chop the garlic and brown it. Then, add the broad beans, mint, and a whole botifarra sausage, and sauté everything together. After that, add a glass of wine, stir, and let cook for about 15 minutes over low heat. Finally, remove the botifarra, cut it into pieces, and serve everything mixed together.

Name: Lentils with chicken and vegetables
Recipe: Wash the vegetables and cut it. Cook the chicken breast on the grill and cut it into cubes. Mix all the ingredients in a bowl: the cooked lentils, the vegetables and the chicken breast. Add extra-virgin olive oil or your preferred dressing.

Name: Hummus
Recipe: Blend the chickpeas in the blender until obtaining a homogeneous paste. Add the tahini, the peeled and minced garlic, the lemon juice, the cumin and the olive oil. Season to taste. Mix for 3 to 5 minutes, until smooth.

Name: Falafel
Recipe: Peel and chop the garlic and onion. Crush the chickpeas, parsley and coriander, and mix with the previous mince. Season the dough, add the yeast and mix until a homogeneous mixture is obtained. If the dough is not consistent enough, chickpea flour can be added to thicken it. Let the dough rest for 30-45 minutes. Make medium balls with the dough, cover them with breadcrumbs and fry them. Drain excess oil and serve.

Name: Broad beans with mint
Recipe: Boil the broad beans together with some mint leaves and then drain them to cool them in a bowl with cold water. Save some for the vinaigrette. Cut some lettuce leaves and julienne the ham. To make the vinaigrette, chop some mint leaves in the mortar and add the oil, vinegar and a pinch of salt. Mix the broad beans, lettuce and ham, and dress everything with the previously prepared vinaigrette.

Name: Broad beans with calamari
Recipe: Clean and cut the squid into pieces, peel and chop the onions and young garlic. In a saucepan with a little oil, slowly fry the vegetables. Add the calamari, sauté them and let them cook over low heat. Add the aromatic herbs (reserve some mint leaves for the end) and the broad beans, stir and add the liqueur. Let cook for about 10-15 minutes. Serve with the mint on top.

Name: Bean and pumpkin soup
Recipe: Peel the pumpkin and cut it into cubes. Sauté the finely chopped onion and the peeled garlic in a pot with hot oil until they begin to colour. Add the pumpkin, salt and pepper to the pot and let it cook for a few more minutes. Add the broth to cover everything. Cover and let cook for 10-15 minutes. Pour the cooked beans and the chopped rosemary and cook for a few more minutes. Blend everything.

Name: Red beans burgers
Recipe: Grate the carrots, chop the garlic and chop the onion finely. Crush the red beans and mix them with the rest of the ingredients. Form about twelve hamburgers and coat them with the breadcrumbs. Brown them in a non-stick pan or in the oven.

Name: Lentil spread
Recipe: Peel and chop the garlics. Blend the lentils with the walnuts, the garlic, the juice from the lemons, the oil, the cumin, the salt and the pepper. Add a little water to improve consistency and more lemon juice, if necessary.

Name: Stewed lentils with vegetables and rice
Recipe: Wash and peel the vegetables, cut into pieces and fry with fried tomato for two minutes. Add the dried lentils and enough water to cover everything, then cook over medium-low heat for 30 minutes. Add the rice and cook for another 20 minutes or until the rice is cooked. Taste and adjust the seasoning to taste.

Name: Stir-fried edamames
Recipe: Cook the frozen edamame in boiling water with a teaspoon of salt for 5 minutes. Drain, and add to the pan in which we will have previously sautéed the minced garlic, sauté the whole thing. Add the lemon juice and soybeans, cook until the broth has evaporated, add the paprika, stir a couple of times and finish.

Name: Chicken and vegetable fajitas
Recipe: In a pan, heat the oil and add the onion and garlic until brown. Add the red and green peppers previously washed and cut into thin strips. Fry, and after a few minutes add the chicken also cut into strips or squares. Separately, wash the other vegetables and cut the tomato into small pieces, grate the carrot, and cut the lettuce into strips. Once the chicken with its sauce is cooked, set aside and serve on a plate. Take advantage of the pan to heat the fajitas. Roll up the fajitas with the chicken and the vegetable sauce, the cut raw vegetables and the corn. Serve.

Name: Baked chicken thighs with potatoes
Recipe: Mix and crush the garlic, parsley, black pepper, saffron and salt in a mortar. Clean the chicken pieces well, removing excess fat. Clean and peel the potatoes and cut them into slices. Cover the bottom of a baking tray with the potatoes and chicken thighs. Brush the chicken with olive oil and with the dressing prepared previously. Squeeze lemon juice on top. Place in the preheated oven at 190ºC and bake for 45 min. Flip chicken after 30 min. so that it browns on both sides. Serve.

Name: Grilled turkey and zucchini skewers
Recipe: The night before: mix all the spices. Cut the meat into medium pieces and put in a bowl. Add the spice mix, minced garlic, salt, lemon juice and a little olive oil. Mix well and leave to rest in the refrigerator. The same day: cut the zucchini into cubes. Thread the pieces of meat and zucchini onto the skewers. Heat the grill. Cook the skewers over high heat until golden brown. Serve.

Name: Turkey burgers with Provencal herbs and sautéed tomatoes
Recipe:
Clean the bone, skin and excess fat from the turkey meat. Chop the meat and grind. Add the spices, the grated lemon peel, and salt and pepper. Mix well until obtaining a homogeneous and compact mass. Shape into a hamburger and reserve.
Wash the tomatoes and cut in half. Drain the chives. Heat the griddle with little oil and cook the burgers on both sides. At the same time, cook the chives and remove when they are lightly toasted. Finally, sauté the tomatoes. Add salt to taste. Serve.

Name: Turkey meatballs in sauce
Recipe: Clean the breast, removing excess fat and grind. Peel and chop the garlic very fine. Pour half of the broth into a bowl and add the meat and the minced garlic. Add the breadcrumbs and salt. Mix until getting a compact dough (can add more breadcrumbs if necessary). Make balls of similar size with the dough. Sauté the meatballs with olive oil over low heat. In another pan, sauté the leek and mushrooms with oil and add the rest of the broth. Let stand 5 min. and mix the sauce with the meatballs. Serve.

Name: Rabbit in apple sauce
Recipe: Clean and chop the apples finely. Season the rabbit and add the minced garlic. Brown in a saucepan with little olive oil until the meat is to taste. Separate the meat pieces and place on a plate. On the other hand, add the apples, onions and tomato sauce in a saucepan. Cover and let simmer. Shred everything except the meat. Mix the sauce with the rabbit. Serve.

Name: Stewed chicken with quinoa and peppers
Recipe: Clean the thighs, removing excess fat. In a frying pan, brown with a little oil. Wash and cut the peppers into pieces and chop the garlic cloves. Once the chicken is browned, add the vegetables, garlic and dry chilli to the same pan and cook for a couple of minutes. Season with pepper to taste. Add the water and cook over medium heat. Next, boil the quinoa for 15 min. (use two or three parts of water for each part of quinoa). Drain the quinoa once boiled and let it rest for a few minutes. Add the cooked quinoa in the same pan. Saute a couple more minutes. Serve.

Name: Baked chicken with figs and rosemary
Recipe: Cut the piece of chicken into portions. Place the portions in a bowl, season with salt and pepper and add the rosemary leaves without the stem, the grated garlic and the grated lemon or orange peel. Mix everything manually so that it is impregnated with the meat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let it rest in the fridge for about 2 hours. After resting, preheat the oven to 200ºC. Place the chicken portions on the baking tray leaving space between pieces. Cut the figs in half and place in the holes in the tray. Drizzle with a little olive oil. Put the tray in the oven and bake between 30 and 40 min. At 15 min. turn the pieces. When the skin of the chicken is golden, turn off the oven. Serve.

Name: Baked chicken nuggets with quinoa batter
Recipe: Cut the chicken breast into strips or cubes, season with salt and pepper and reserve. Cook the quinoa for about 14 min. Preheat the oven to 180ºC and prepare a baking tray with baking paper. Drain the quinoa and spread out on the baking tray with hands. Put the tray in the oven and bake until crisp (between 17 and 20 min.). Put the quinoa in a bowl and add Parmesan cheese, oregano, salt and the spices, and mix well. Whisk the egg. Coat the chicken strips in the egg and then in the mixture of quinoa and spices. Split the nuggets on the baking tray with clean paper. Bake at 180ºC with a little olive oil for 12-15 min. Serve.

Name: Crispy chicken with oat flakes
Recipe: Fillet the chicken breast into strips and season. Beat the eggs in a bowl, add the chopped parsley and mustard, and mix. In a deep plate, mix the rolled oats and sesame seeds. Coat the chicken fillets with the egg and then with the oat mixture. Distribute the chicken on a tray with baking paper. Drizzle with little olive oil. Preheat the oven to 200ºC. Bake for 15 min. at 200ºC, and turn around and leave another 15 min. further. Serve.

Name: Baked turkey rolls stuffed with mushrooms
Recipe:
Prepare the filling: Finely chop the leek, garlic and onion, and fry in olive oil over low heat. Clean and chop the mushrooms and olives, and add to the previous sauce. Sauté for 5 min. further. Season the sauce and blend until it forms a dense mass. Salt and pepper and let cool.
Prepare the turkey rolls: Fillet the breast and stretch the fillets well. Overlap fillets to form one large layer. Cover the turkey layer with the cooked ham and add the mushroom mass and mozzarella on top. Close the roll carefully with the help of wooden toothpicks. Seal and brown the roll in a pan with a little olive oil. Put the roll in the oven at 180ºC for 15 min. Serve.

Name: Chicken breast booklets stuffed with spinach and cheese
Recipe:
Prepare the filling: Wash the spinach and chop it. Add the spinach and pine nuts in a pan with a little olive oil. Sauté 2 min. and season.
Prepare the chicken booklets: Fillet the chicken breast. Open each fillet in half in the shape of a book, leaving one side uncut. Fill with spinach and cover with a slice of mozzarella. Close the booklet joining the two layers of chicken fillet with a wooden toothpick. Place on a plate, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 30 to 40 minutes. Next, place the booklet on a baking tray and bake at 200ºC for 20 min. Once brown, remove from the oven. Serve.

Name: Stewed rabbit thigh with sautéed wheat
Recipe: Soak the wheat grains the night before. The same day, cook the wheat with water for 30 min. Drain and season. Peel and chop the garlic, onion and carrots, and sauté in a saucepan with a little olive oil. Season and reserve. Season the rabbit thighs with salt and pepper and brown them in a pan with olive oil. Incorporate the rabbit brown in the casserole with the vegetables and add the flour, the ground black pepper and the rest of the spices and sauté. Add the paprika, broth and tomato sauce. Cook over low heat for 25-30 min. Remove the rabbit thighs on a plate, and blend the sauce. Add the thighs back into the sauce and cook for 2-3 min. Reserve. On the other hand, chop the green pepper and sauté it in a pan with olive oil. Season. Add the cooked wheat and sauté the whole. Serve the rabbit thigh with the sauce and accompanied by the wheat.

Name: Roast rabbit with soy sause and honey
Recipe: Cut the rabbit into small pieces, season with salt and pepper, place in a bowl and add the soy and honey. Mix well and place on a baking tray. Bake at 190°C for 20-25 minutes. After 15 minutes, baste with the rest of the soy and honey mixture left in the bowl. Peel and slice the garlic and fry in a large frying pan with a drizzle of oil. Peel and julienne the onions and add. Chop the peppers into fine strips and add. Cook well. Season to taste. When it is well caramelised, add the meat broth and cook until it evaporates. Peel the tomatoes and cut them into crescents. Place them in a large dish. Place the pieces of rabbit and the frittata on top. Season with the juice from the rabbit and serve. Garnish with a leaf of parsley.

Name: Turkey breast marinated with orange
Recipe: Prepare the marinade ingredients: turkey breast, orange and lemon juice (and a little grated), some spices to taste (pepper, ginger). Put the turkey breast in a freezer bag with all the marinade ingredients, tie in a knot, massage and place in a bowl. Leave in the fridge overnight. The next day, put a spoonful of olive oil in a saucepan. When it is very hot, add the breast, drained of the marinade. Seal over a high heat. Remove and set aside. In the same pan, add another spoonful of olive oil and the chopped vegetables. Sauté everything. When they are soft, add the reserved breast. Add the white wine and allow to reduce a little. Pour all the marinade into the pan. It should cover at least half of the loin. Cover the pan. When the second orange ring rises, lower the heat and leave for 10 minutes. Ready to serve.

Name: Pickled sardines
Recipe: Clean the sardines. Flour them and fry them in a pan with plenty of oil. When they are browned on each side, transfer them to a dish, put them on kitchen paper and set them aside. Now fry the julienned onion, sliced carrot and coarsely chopped garlic in the olive oil. Add the bay leaf and peppercorns and cook slowly. When the vegetables are cooked, add the paprika and immediately pour in the vinegar and white wine. Add the salt and herbs. Wait for the alcohol to evaporate. You will be able to tell by the aroma coming from the pan. It is important to taste the marinade to give it just the right amount of strength that you like, this is personal. To do this, add water until it's balanced, it's easy to add another whole glass of water if you don't like it too strong. Leave to reduce over a low heat for about 15 minutes. At the end of this time, add the fried sardines and cook them in the marinade for a few minutes, shaking the pan to prevent them from falling apart. Remove from the heat and leave to cool before serving. It is best to leave them in the marinade overnight in the fridge and take them out a while before serving so that they are at room temperature.

Name: Baked salmon with vegetables
Recipe: Peel and cut the potato, carrot and onion into thin slices. Cut the peppers into cubes. Chop the garlic. Place the vegetables and garlic on a baking tray. Place ½ glass of water. Spice with salt and pepper. Add the oil. Mix and place for 30 minutes (approximately) in a preheated oven at 200 ºC. Later, place the salmon loin on the vegetables, skin side up, previously seasoned with salt and pepper. Bake for an additional 20 minutes. Serve.

Name: Hake with green sauce
Recipe: Peel and mince the garlic and sauté in a casserole. Add the grated onion and fry in a little oil over low heat until well cooked. Add the flour and stir well, leave for 2 minutes. Pour in the broth and stir to prevent lumps from forming with the flour. Let cook for 10 minutes. Chop the fresh parsley and season the hake. Add everything in the casserole. Cover the pot and cook over medium heat for five minutes. Serve.

Name: Stuffed Baked Hake
Recipe: Place the mussels in a casserole over high heat, without water, and place the lid. Cook for approximately two minutes, or until the mussels open. Remove them from the heat and leave them aside until later use. In another casserole, fry the leek, onion and garlic. Spice with salt and pepper. Cook for 10 minutes stirring. Chop the previously peeled prawns, the mussels and the parsley and add them to the casserole. Integrate the ingredients and cook for 5 minutes. Add the flour. Mix everything and let cook and toast for 2 minutes. Slowly add the fish broth, avoiding the formation of lumps. Cook for 5 minutes. Let the water evaporate and thicken. Remove from the fire. Season the hake fillets with salt and pepper and place them on a baking tray, skin side down. Place the filling on top. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Cover the preparation with another loin, with the skin facing up. Place the stuffed hake in the oven previously reheated to 200ºC. Cook for 20 minutes. Serve.

Name: Mussels with marinara sauce
Recipe: Open, clean and place the mussels in a pot over high heat. Cover the casserole and let it cook with steam for 2 minutes, stirring. Remove from the heat, drain the water and reserve. In a pot, place the oil and fry the minced garlic for 5 minutes. Add the flour and stir to prevent sticking for 2 minutes. Add fish broth, chopped parsley and ground cayenne pepper. Stir all the ingredients until integral. Introduce mussels to the preparation and cook for 5 minutes.Season with salt and serve.

Name: Sardines Baked
Recipe: Clean, peel and cut the onion into strips and the carrot into slices. Peel the garlic cloves and cut in half. Preheat the oven to 200º C. Clean the sardines from the guts, scales and head and place on a baking tray lined with baking paper, salt and bake for 15 minutes. Sauté the vegetables in a casserole with a few drops of extra virgin olive oil until soft. Add the salt and aromatic herbs and cook for 10 minutes. Add the vegetables on top of the sardines and cook for 5-10 minutes watching. Ready to serve.

Name: Calamari stewed with onion
Recipe: Cut the onion into julienne strips. Place it in a casserole previously preheated with olive oil. Chop the cayenne pepper and integrate with the onion. Cook until the onion is transparent. Lower the fire. Add the fish broth. Let it evaporate over medium heat for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, cut the squid into rings. Add the squid to the preparation of the pot. Cook for 20 minutes on medium-high heat, with a lid on. Stir every two minutes, preventing it from sticking. Season with salt and remove from heat. Serve.

Name: Grilled tuna with garlic and parsley
Recipe: Chop the garlic and parsley and place them in a container with oil and the lemon juice. Mix everything and let it rest for 10 minutes. Season the tuna loins on both sides with salt and ground pepper. Preheat a frying pan with oil and place the tuna. Cook for 3 minutes on both sides. Remove from the fire. Place the tuna loin on a plate and cover with the garlic and parsley dressing on top. Serve.

Name: Anchovies in vinegar
Recipe: Clean the anchovies with cold water, removing the head, guts and bones. Leave the anchovies open in half and remove the tail. Wash them very well, without traces of blood. Dry them with absorbent paper. Prepare the mixture of vinegar with water in a cup. Place the anchovies in a bowl, skin side down. Cover between layer and layer of anchovy with salt and add the vinegar and water mixture. Everything must be covered. Let stand in the fridge for 3-4 hours. After the time has elapsed, drain the anchovies and transfer them to another clean source. Finely chop the garlic and parsley. Spray the anchovies with oil and add the chopped garlic and parsley. Rest for 24 hours. Serve.

Name: Cod with tomato sauce
Recipe: Preheat a pot with oil over low heat. Introduce the cod fillets with the skin facing down, in contact with the base. Let cook 8 minutes on each side, stirring the pot from time to time. Reserve until later use. Peel and chop the garlic and onion. Add them to a preheated pot with oil. Season with salt and cook until golden. Wash, peel and finely chop the tomato. Add to casserole. Add the sugar. Cook everything covered for 25-30 minutes, stirring frequently. The sauce should be reduced. Add the cod loin, and cover it with the sauce. Heat everything at medium heat for 3 minutes. Serve.

Name: Baked dorada with potatoes and peppers
Recipe: Preheat the oven to 200ºC. Peel and cut the potatoes, onion and peppers into thin slices. Peel and chop the garlic together with the parsley, the fish broth and the oil in a food processor. Oil a baking tray and place the potatoes, season with salt, and add the onion and peppers on top. Season again with salt. Add the garlic mixture, parsley, broth and oil. Place the tray in the oven and cook for approximately 30 minutes. Once the vegetables are cooked, place the sea bream on top and add a little more of the garlic and parsley mixture. Cook for 15 minutes or until the fish has white eyes. Plate and serve.

Name: Tuna burgers and baked vegetables
Recipe: Wash, cut and chop the onion, tomato, leek and carrot. Whisk the egg. Add all the ingredients (vegetables, tuna, eggs and breadcrumbs) to a bowl and mix well. Season with oregano and a pinch of salt. With the preparation created, shape a hamburger and place them on a previously oiled oven tray or with parchment paper. Place the tray in the oven previously preheated to 180ºC. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve.

Name: Grilled snuff with green asparagus and tomato
Recipe: Clean and cut the asparagus and cherry tomatoes. Peel and chop the garlic and add it to a preheated pan with oil add. Let cook over low heat for 2 minutes. Add the asparagus, leave for two minutes and add the cherry tomatoes. Add half a glass of water and let reduce. In a preheated griddle add the monkfish. Leave 5 minutes per side. Add to the fish the mixture of vegetables, garlic and parsley. Serve.

Name: Monkfish fideuá
Recipe: Cut the garlic cloves and the green pepper into very small pieces. In a pan with oil, fry the garlic cloves and the green pepper. Let it brown and add the monkfish pieces. Grate the tomato and add it to the paella together with the noodles. Let it brown slightly. Add the fish broth until it covers the noodles and add saffron. Let cook for about 10 minutes until the noodles are tender. Serve.

Name: Cod cake
Recipe: In a preheated pan with oil, cook the cod for 10 minutes. Add salt and pepper. Once cooked, crumble it and reserve. Peel and cut the potatoes into small cubes. Boil the potatoes in a saucepan with plenty of water until tender. Drain and mash the potatoes. Reserve. Peel and finely chop the garlic and onion. fry them in a frying pan over low heat. When the onion is cooked add the tomato concentrate and cook for a few minutes. Add the shredded cod. Stir to prevent the preparation from sticking. Add the mashed potato, the egg and season to taste. Stir until a homogeneous mass is obtained. Cover a removable mold, suitable for oven, with parchment paper. Add the mixture evenly inside the mold. Flatten the surface. Sprinkle with the grated cheese and place the mold in the oven, preheated to 200º C. Cook the cake for 20-25 minutes or until the surface is golden. Remove the mold from the oven and wait a few minutes before unmolding. Transfer to a platter and serve.
